author: By Emma Munbodh
title: New York city guide: cheap flights, free attractions, and hotels that won't break the bank
text:
Planning a trip to the Big Apple? Believe it or not, a trip to New York City doesn't always have to cost an arm and a leg.
It's the city that never sleeps and it may well be known as the most expensive destination for a night’s hotel stay, but according to Tripadvisor , there are ways to experience the Big Apple on a budget.
We asked the online travel guide for their top cheap eats, places to stay and free attractions, and here are the results.
For European city breaks, see our guide on the 10 best destinations for a long weekend here.
How to find cheap flights: £295 return The most popular airline for cheap flights from the UK to New York is British Airways and Virgin Atlantic .
BA offers 17 flights every day to New York, and that's just London. They also regularly host sales, especially for those travelling last minute, with return economy seats from £383 return.
Virgin also hosts sales throughout the year, you can keep an eye on the sales here .
Other popular sites worth checking for low fares is Skyscanner, with fares from £295 return , Expedia from £363 return and lastminute.com for all the best late deals. Cheap Flights also has flights from anywhere in the UK from £329.
Top 4 hotels for under £100 Tripadvisor has a great price guide on the 30 best cheap hotels in New York.
Here are the top 4 best value budget hotels as rated by holidaymakers.
1. Hotel 31: 4/5 rating on TripAdvisor
Located in the heart of Manhattan’s shopping district and just a 5 minute walk from the Empire State Building, Hotel 31 offers private air-conditioned rooms, 24-hour concierge, daily maid service and cable TV.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said: “I truly think you'd be hard pressed to find somewhere that's better value! Great location, spotlessly clean, lovely staff and nice rooms.”
2. Broadway Hotel and Hostel: 3.5/5 rating on TripAdvisor Situated on New York’s Upper West Side, Broadway Hotel and Hostel offers private rooms and dorm accommodation, just moments from Central Park. Other amenities include a theatre room, dining area and library.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said: “All around, it's an excellent little place. Very affordable and the rooms are very clean.”
3. Belnord Hotel: 3.5/5 rating on TripAdvisor
The Belnord Hotel comprises of 119 rooms, across five floors in the trendy Upper-West Side. Guests can also enjoy the recently renovated courtyard and can access the on-site fitness centre.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said: “Love this hotel! Rooms are what the sightseer on a budget needs; a quiet, comfortable place to sleep.”
4. St. Marks Hotel: 3.5/5 rating on TripAdvisor Set in the heart of the East Village, St. Marks Hotel is close to a number of New York’s main attractions.
All rooms are air-conditioned and equipped with telephones, flat-panelled TVs with DVD players and free Wi-Fi.
Top 4 cheap eats 1. 53rd & 6th Halal: 4.5/5 rating on TripAdvisor
Open from 11am – 4am the popular 53rd & 6th Halal street food cart has been serving its Middle Eastern cuisine since 1990.
Here you’ll find lamb or chickenrice bowls, alongside other traditional dishes all under $7.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said: “Amazing place to grab a bite to eat. The food is amazing and a steal considering how much they give you.”
2. Hummus Place: 4.5/5 rating on TripAdvisor With multiple locations across the city, Hummus Place serves up traditional kosher Israeli cuisine with dishes including Shakshuka stew, falafels and of course a variety of hummus.
Also popular is the brunch menu which includes freshly squeezed juice and tea or coffee.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said: “Easily affordable prices, friendly service and a fun atmosphere. Plus the food is always fresh and absolutely terrific.”
3. Joe's Pizza, Carmine St: 4.5/5 rating on TripAdvisor
Established in 1975, Joe's Pizza - Carmine St is a family run pizzeria that has become a New York institution and is regularly voted New York’s best pizza.
Located in Greenwich Village, this small restaurant serves traditionally-made full size pizzas or by the slice.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said: “I couldn’t believe how cheap the pizza was. The slice was massive, with good quality ingredients, I was very impressed.”
4. Mamoun's Falafel, 4.5/5 rating on TripAdvisor and 211 reviews Mamoun's Falafel has been serving traditional Middle Eastern foodfrom its flagship Greenwich Village restaurant since 1971. The menu offers traditional kebabs, shawarma and their award winning falafels.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said: “Every time I am in New York, Mamoun’s is my first stop. The falafels are cheap, made quickly and are amazingly tasty!”
Top free Attractions 1. Central Park New York City Manhattan Central Park panorama in winter
Comprising of 843 acres in central Manhattan, Central Park is open daily from 6am – 1am. Visitors can explore the many attractions in the park including the reservoir, baseball pitches, boating lake and its numerous gardens.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said “How can you not love Central Park? It's a combination of history, romance, gorgeous architecture, and ambience. It's a great place to walk, whether crowded or on a quieter day.”
2. The National September 11 Memorial & Museum A tribute of remembrance to the people killed in the terror attacks of September 11, 2001, the The National September 11 Memorial & Museum features two twin reflecting pools, where the world trade centre once stood alongside a museum telling the story of 9/11. Visitors can also book guided tours or hire an audio guide for a cost.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said “This is a definite must see! The memorial is beautiful”
3. The High Line Elevated above the streets of New York, you'll find The High Line .
This once derelict freight rail line has been transformed into a public park, offering unique views of the city and a variety of activities throughout the year. Located on Manhattan’s Upper West Side, it runs from Gansevoort Street to West 34 Street.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said “I adore The Highline in New York. It's an absolute gem and is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the City.”
4. Grand Central Terminal Getty Grand Central Terminal is illuminated before dusk
First opened in 1913, Grand Central Terminal is now one of the busiest terminals in the world. Visitors can explore its 68 shops, 35 places to eat or simply admire the building’s Beau-arts architecture that has been the setting of countless Hollywood movies.
As one TripAdvisor traveller said “Stunningly beautiful. A must visit for any tourist to NYC.”
